fu.esi

Class IMI_ESI<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.esi.IMI_ESI<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IMI_ESI_ByteArray

    public class IMI_ESI<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates an Extended Split Index that fully resides in memory (IMI, In-Memory-Index). It allows to register arbitrary objects that reside in their bounding rect. Later they can be looked up in an hashtable manner, i.e. the caller can query for all objects that reside in a given rectangle.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(T obj,
                     double min_lat,
                     double max_lat,
                     double min_lon,
                     double max_lon)
        Register an object unter a certain bounding rect. Later it can be searched by this rect.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object
        min_lat - bounding box (min latitude)
        max_lat - bounding box (min longitude)
        min_lon - bounding box (max latitude)
        max_lon - bounding box (max longitude)

      • close

        public void close()
        The list of registered objects is complete and the index now can be searched. It is possible to register new objects, but then, the index has to be closed again prior to search.

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> get(double min_lat,
                                  double max_lat,
                                  double min_lon,
                                  double max_lon,
                                  boolean completelyInside)
        Get all objects that reside in a given rectangle.
        Parameters:
        min_lat - query rectangle (min latitude)
        max_lat - query rectangle (min longitude)
        min_lon - query rectangle (max latitude)
        max_lon - query rectangle (max longitude)
        completelyInside, - true, if only objects with a rectangle that completely resides in the given rect. false, if also overlapping rects are collected.
        Returns:
        list of objects
